In a small Southern town, four vigilantes wrongfully execute a mentally challenged man. After the court sets them free, a strange apparition seeks revenge as the legend of the Scarecrow begins.

Step into the chilling world of 1980s made-for-TV horror with this deep dive into a cult classic! This suspenseful breakdown explores the eerie atmosphere and lasting legacy of Dark Night of the Scarecrow, a standout film that helped define rural horror. Produced by CBS Entertainment Productions and directed by veteran TV filmmaker Frank De Felitta, this psychological thriller blends supernatural vengeance with Southern Gothic storytelling.

Starring Charles Durning as the cold-hearted mailman Otis Hazelrigg, the film also features haunting performances by Robert F. Lyons, Claude Earl Jones, Lane Smith, Tonya Crowe, and Larry Drake as the tragic Bubba Ritter. Set in a small town filled with paranoia and prejudice, this movie delivers both social commentary and spine-tingling tension.

When young Marylee Williams (Tonya Crowe) is found viciously mauled, all hell breaks loose in her small rural town. A gang of bigots pursue a suspect: her mentally challenged friend Bubba Ritter (Larry Drake).

metadata.Plot: An intellectually disabled man is unjustly accused of attacking a young girl. Disguised as a scarecrow, he hides in a cornfield, only to be hunted down and shot. Later, after it is revealed he saved the girl from a vicious dog attack, members of the search posse are killed by a mysterious scarecrow.
